intro: Cyclophorus nudus, commonly known as the naked cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are adapted for pollination by insects. Cyclophorus nudus is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters.
